data.title: Client crashed when trying to join lobby
data.body:
I joined a lobby, immediately exited, and joined a different lobby. Upon trying to load the new lobby, my client crashed. 
I got an error that said "Unable to read beyond the end of the stream," which is completely new to me. I've attached the full exception.log below...I'm sure this is a minor issue that can be fixed after the next release. 

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20161019
Date: 2017-04-05 23:12:12Z
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.EndOfStreamException`: Unable to read beyond the end of the stream.
   at System.IO.BinaryReader.ReadString()
   at OpenRA.Order.Deserialize(World world, BinaryReader r)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderIO.ToOrderList(Byte[] bytes, World world)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorder.IsGameStart(Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.ReplayRecorder.Receive(Int32 clientID, Byte[] data)
   at OpenRA.Network.EchoConnection.Receive(Action`2 packetFn)
   at OpenRA.Network.OrderManager.TickImmediate()
   at OpenRA.Sync.<CheckSyncUnchanged>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0()
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged[T](World world, Func`1 fn)
   at OpenRA.Sync.CheckSyncUnchanged(World world, Action fn)
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Fix the extraction helicopter not showing up in Monster Tank Madness
data.body:
Fixes #13068.

It had something to do with the spawnpoint lying outside the map bounds (#12458 ?).
Further fixes:
- Intial cash is set to 0 in rules.yaml (otherwise it would start with 5000 and tick down to 0 as the game starts).
- Fixed the explosions of the civilian buildings. They spawned infantry (which looked weird) and all other civilian buildings on the map had wrong explosions.
- On that note: The mod rules let Oil Pumps spawn infantry as well (in addition to the normal husk), which looks kind of weird as well, imho.
- Removed a misplaced barrel, which looked glitchy:
![mtmbarrel](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/24725550/af75e174-1a4f-11e7-955f-d83ae997b3d2.png)

data.title: Mouse wheel zoom without modifier option

Add new 'Scroll-zoom Modifier' option - None for simpler/faster zooming.
Requested by users, e.g.: https://www.reddit.com/r/openra/comments/60qt61/zoom_on_scroll/

data.title: Added WithTurretedAttackAnimation.
data.body:
Simple use-case:
I've got a Tank with a turret which has an attack sequence. However OpenRA renders it as body, so the result is an attacking turret with an idle turret on it. This PR ~~makes WithAttackAnimation be aware of who actually attacks and changes the correct sprite~~ adds a new trait to allow turrets to have an attack sequence.

![withturretedattackanimation](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1322277/24838691/6284ff16-1d4d-11e7-9e7d-18a6db26e55d.gif)

data.title: Disable ToolTip while using support powers #12853
data.body: I didn't find an explicit way how to identify we are using support power. There isn't some ISupportPowerOrderGenerator or a flag IsPowerActivated, but disabling tooltip for anything different (like support power) than standard operation seems to work fine.

data.title: D2K - Add Ordos Mission 4
Join already started game as a spectator if allowed by a game admin
data.body:
Hi!

I'd like to discuss a feature that I mentioned in the subject. It seems to be not hard to implement, just to send simulation state to the player as it joins currently running game and then the player runs the same simulation as other players and specs in the currently running match.

It would be cool to be able to join a running game to spectate how it goes, might be useful on the tournaments as well.

Cheers.

data.title: Feature - Separate Menu and In-Game Audio Settings
data.body: Isolate the audio settings between in-game and menu. It would be nice to be able to disable the background game audio. Use case: Disable background audio when tabbing out or chatting on the global terminal for an extensive period of time.

data.title: Bib of Spawned Actors via lua
data.body:
The Bib of lua spawned actors is not working correctly.
You can for example build on it.

data.title: Chronoshifted tanks not teleported back after timeout
data.body:
I was playing a 2v2 game with my friends and towards the end of the game (I had to stop it since this really screwed me over) my opponent chronoshifted a bunch of mammoth tanks into my base to destroy my missile silo. But after the chrono timeout, only some of the tanks got teleported back to his base while 4 remained _permanently_ in my base, continuing to destroy the rest of my buildings.

I'm not sure how this happened, but I noticed that the tanks which remained after the chrono timeout were ones that got hit by my artillery units although I could be wrong. I have provided a link to the replay file below so that you can examine it. It might be related to #8670 which has not been closed yet, but I felt a new report was needed since that is quite old and we're on a newer version of the game. 

[Link to replay file](https://www.dropbox.com/s/df7oqp8f85hrhvf/OpenRA-2017-04-03T162557Z.orarep?dl=0) 

The bug can be seen in the last few minutes of the game, and the chronoshift happens at the bottom left base (red Germany).

data.title: Scatter Units on and around tile ordered to rather than try to cram them all onto it
data.body: Just wondering since the original games did this at least in RA2 and TS where instead of trying to compact all the units onto a single tile they are ordered to the game scattered them around the ordered to tile.  Figured it'd be a nice thing to have for later and might help with both AI and player troop movements.

data.title: Grant Condition Integers

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
This replaces #12925 (Plug Slot, Health, & Damage State Condition Variables) for laying the groundwork for sharing integer values via conditions. This PR uses pseudo-property conditions to utilize the condition linter and organize multiple attributes of a trait with a common prefix identifying the trait without making the modder name a condition for each integer/Boolean value shared. As an example, this PR replaces `TimedConditonBar` with `ConditionBar` and exposes the timers of a few traits to demonstrate. `ConditionBar` also shows using `ConditionExpression`s as dynamic field values, which I would like to apply to `TurnSpeed`, `Speed`, `Power`, etc.

---
### Future Direction:
The reason I had #12925 expose health was to do this: `Power: 200 * health / health.max`, replacing `ScalePowerWithHealth` and making it possible to apply the same thing to values of fields in other traits. Being able to set `Speed` and `TurnSpeed` in `Mobile` separately as `ConditionExpression`s would allow for deploying infantry to turn without being able to move (`Speed: speed-value * !deployed`) without adding custom logic such as a `MovementSpeedMultiplier` and maybe a `TurnSpeedMultiplier`.

Using `enum`s to select exposed properties allow for exposing a range of values without a lot of MiniYaml. For example, expressions like `health.damage >= DamageStates.heavy` are fairly clear, and can be given its own name using `GrantCondition`.
```yaml
	Health:
		Condition: health
		ConditionProperties: damage #, max
		ConditionDamageStateConstants: critical # all under DamageStates condition
	GrantCondition@CRITICAL:
		RequiresCondition: health.damage >= DamageStates.critical
		Condition: criticalspeed
		GrantPermanently: true # NOTE: must be added to GrantCondition
...

       
	Health:
		Condition: health
		ConditionProperties: damage
		ConditionDamageStateConstants: heavy, critical # all under DamageStates condition
	...
	SpeedMultiplier@DAMAGED:
		RequiresCondition: health.damage == DamageStates.heavy
		Modifier: 80
	SpeedMultiplier@CRITICAL:
		RequiresCondition: health.damage == DamageStates.critical
		Modifier: 60
```

data.title: TD Commando ScanRadius.
data.body:
Changed ScanRadius trait on Commando from 6 to 8.

Makes it so the Commando fires at a range of 8 instead of 6 when attack moving.

data.title: cannot press esc when connection is lost
data.body: When server leaves, you cannot press esc to leave game, you have to use mouse, then abort mission.

data.title: Fix broken actor name case insensitivity #4124
data.body:
All ActorReference fields are changed to lower case in FieldLoader

Example:
MNLYR:
	Transforms:
		IntoActor: FTUR	#had to be **ftur** before
FTUR:
	Health:
		HP: 1000

data.title: Bug fix: Trying to deploy concrete walls on moving units #12372
data.body: This PR resolves issue #12372 "deploying a (single) concrete wall on top of a moving unit stops the wall from being placed, and takes away the money I spent on the wall" for LineBuild orders.

data.title: Lost players except Host can not pause game #12227
data.body: Host can always pause game (as host can also abort game), other 'Lost' players can not pause game.

data.title: Remove ingame mod chooser.
data.body:
This implements the remaining engine changes to properly support stand-alone mod installs and removes the ability to install oramod packages to the support dir.  All that remains for #12554 after this and the other PRs are merged are straightforward packaging changes to install mod-specific launch shortcuts on each platform.

Making `Game.Mod` a required argument means that players can no longer double click OpenRA.Game.exe in their file manager and expect the game to launch.  They must instead use the launchers shipped in the installers, or for self-compiled versions either the [MD/XS gui](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12906), [the improved](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/12992) `launch-game.sh`, [the new](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/13033) `launch-game.cmd`, or the launch scripts in [the stand-alone mod template](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAModTemplate).

data.body: Overlooked regressions from inheritance PR.

data.title: Would an espionage building be helpful?
data.body:
Hi,

One feature I have seen on other RTS games that resemble OpenRA (e.g., Outlive) is an espionage building which users can use (for a charge and these capabilities may take some time for them to come into affect after the user selects them, sort of how it takes a while to create military units and buildings) to spy on their enemies (see everything their enemy sees, see their finances), lock their buildings (rendering them unusuable for several seconds), redirect/neutralize atomic bombs, view a small segment of area presently under the fog-of-war, *etc.* Not sure if anyone is interested in adding such a feature to this game, but it would certainly be enticing to me. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: Why not allow users to set the difficulty of the game in single player mode?
data.body:
Hi,

I do enjoy OpenRA, mostly because it's the closest open-source alternative I've found to [Outlive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outlive), a proprietary futuristic RTS game from 2001. One thing I would like to suggest, however, is that you add difficulty modes (e.g., easy, medium, difficult) for how difficult single player games are. So that those of us that are poorer at strategy games can learn the ropes without getting totally annihilated by the opposing team (played by the computer). Likewise those of us that have found the existing game difficulty too easy can still get ourselves a challenge by the most difficult mode. 

Thanks for your time,
Brenton

data.title: TD Artillery/MRLS Vision.
data.body:
This is changing the vision of Artillery and MRLS from 8c0 to 5c0.

The reason behind this is because we have scouting artillery and MRLS units that have a much larger vision range then infantry and the same vision as hummers and buggies. This turns into games where people build infantry and artillery/MRLS armies and march of death to the enemy. Its more counterable in 1v1 and 2v2 but team games of 3v3+ it becomes incredibly spammy of these units and hard to stop.

http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=301205#301205

I was told about a hit scan range issue that is in RA but I haven't found it. The only case of this is the units will fire once scouted and when the scouting unit dies they continue to fire. However, if you do attack move again or the unit that it is firing at dies then it needs to scout again.

data.title: Add Juggernaut to TS
data.body:
Collateral changes:
- added `StartBurstReport` support to weapons, because otherwise you'd hear 9(!) shots when the Jugger fires since the soundfile itself is already a triple-shot sound (and yes, this was a bug/design error in original TS/FS)
- added Name field to `WithSpriteBody` to allow assigning modifying traits to specific sprite bodies
- made `WithMoveAnimation` compatible with multiple sprite bodies per actor (to avoid using the `WithInfantryBody` hack for the Juggernaut)
- made `GrantConditionOnDeploy` compatible with multiple sprite bodies per actor and `WithMakeAnimation` work for deploying actors
